Yes, the cake is a lie.

Portal was a risky game for Valve, but come October 10th, 2007, it blew the gaming industry away with its thought-provoking puzzles, endless replay value, and a robotic antagonist that promises you a delicious cake at the end of the test (NOT REALLY).

Had it not been for those several students and their conceptual game idea, Narbacular Drop, and had Gabe Newell never layed eyes on the project, Portal (and the Cake) would have never seen the light of day.

10/10 would want to eat some cake- ER, I'M SORRY... I mean, would want to play this game.

Великолепная игра! Она настолько самобытна и неординарна, что поиграв в нее и услышав лишь одно слово ПОРТАЛ, у Вас в голове рисуются грандиозные лабиринты, которые тут-же охота исследовать. Да, игра короткая, но зато какая! К тому же, для искушенных игроков, после прохождения игры есть куча усложненных комнат бросающих Вам вызов и вполне способных занять еще не на один час,а то и десяток. Рекомендую.
Amazing!  It has such original mechanics and a great surreal industrial atmosphere.  Loved the ambient music and sounds emanating from all around me.  And the writing was superb of course!

I recently purchased Portal 1 & 2 through a bundle sale and I have to say I'm incredibly glad I did!

I personally prefer puzzle games that challenge me, and make me utilize objects or logistics in order to progress. This game does that and then some. It bends the laws of physics in a brilliant (and not-too-confusing) way and even throws in some cheeky humor. There are times when you can't figure out how to get past an area for the life of you, but juuuust before you chuck your computer through a window, you figure it out and feel the sweet satisfaction as you move on to the next level.

Even though Portal is a short game (I beat it in 5 hours my first time round), it is definitely worth playing. Especially to see the ending. No spoilers here, but lets just say that it "takes the cake". ;)

If you are a person that enjoys puzzles but also a slightly creepy atmosphere, this is definitely the game for you.  The puzzles are very interesting and challenging, but not to the point where you have to look online for the solution of every chamber.  The only bad thing that I can find in this game is that it's really short.  But despite it being short, it is still, 100%, without a doubt, worth your money.  Not only is it a great game, but it leads into one of the best game of the century Portal 2.  I recommend this game to anyone who wants a quick game with high-quality puzzles.

Excellent game!

Simple controls parred with an intriguing store line make you dissapointed by the length of the overall experience. Rounding out at roughly 2 1/2 hours total, this game is an amazing journey. Mechanics is the word that comes to mind when reviewing this game.

Visuals:

Simple surroundings (square rooms, bland halways, same elevator....) won't turn any heads or break any rules....that is until you start walking through walls...again and again. Portal animations are done well including being able to watch yourself run through the portal you're running through. The character model animations are a little stiff, but since there isn't any 3rd person option this doesn't really play a major role. Trust me when I say that you'll be to busy making yourself dizzy running through portals to worry about watching yourself...run through portals.

Gameplay:

Simple until you get to the more reactionary parts of the later game. Dying isn't a punishment as you start back at the begining of the smaller puzzles while the larger ones have checkpoints (sometimes multiple) so you don't have to waste time from the start. This game focuses on simple mechanics (4 or 5 i think) and then extrapilates them (in different combinations) into a 2 1/2 hour experience. This more often than not has been done poorly by previous games but when parred with a comical (homicidal) mainframe, it makes for an enjoyable romp.

Sound:

Foot steps sound normal as does the landing sound after jumping or falling. No death sound is used (you won't miss it...) though one was used for the multiple security drones you encounter (and will inevitably oust.) The star in this game (concerning sound) is by far the mainframe computer out to kill you for her experiments. Her dry (logical) take on your circumstances (and your hopeful demise) is ALWAYS well timed to break up any transition as well as giving the player a well timed laugh. I found myself playing the game again just to hear what she had to say...again....

Overall:

I love this game. It's something that my children have attempted to play and enjoy (though the later levels are beyond their skill level) and one I've loved playing again and again. I can't wait to play it again if for no other reason than to listen to the credits again.

Portal is a must have in any games collection: The "The Godfather" of film collections, the "Shazam" of iPhone apps. 
I only wish the game is given FULL CONTROLLER support as it should be a staple within Big Picture Mode.

The more I played this game, the more I liked it. The more engaging it got. The more curious I became about what was going on in these test chambers. It only took me 4 or 5 hours to beat, yet somehow Valve managed to compress a truly remarkable amount of content into those hours. I didn't expect for a puzzle game to have such a fascinating story, which I won't tell you about for fear of ruining it. Nor did I anticipate the hilarious dialogue (or really, monologue), or the unique gameplay, or the unsettling atmosphere. Graphics are nothing special, but trust me when I say it doesn't matter: they don't bring down the game as a whole.
        Before playing this game, I read on several websites that it's the best game of all time. I'm not sure I agree with that bold statement, but I was so unprecedently stunned by Portal, I can understand how someone could make a case for it.
        Outstanding game that everyone who owns Steam, or just exists, should play. 9/10, think with portals!

Незамысловатая на первый взгляд игра становится довольно увлекательной в процессе освоения её "многообразия".
Ну, то есть на самом деле действовать придётся в довольно стеснённых рамках, предложенных системой, и погулять будет особо то и негде. Но суть игры иная: Вам ведь поручено очень важное научное исследование, которым Вы и занимаетесь, следуя строгим правилам. Так что в этом смысле всё верно. 
Игра предполагает испытание вашей способности мыслить нестандартно, но наличие логики и умение действовать последовательно так же пригодятся. Игра очень увлекательная. И очень своеобразная. 
Но будет весело, можете не сомневаться :)

7/10 - Short and sweet fps puzzler

Pros:
- The "portal" mechanic is very well done and allows for many inventive techinques.
- The game is paced very well and gets you used to the mind-bending world of portal-creating before expecting a lot from you.
- Although a short game (it took me 2-3 hours to beat), the challenges are nothing to scoff at: You will need to become a Portal expert before you will be able to take the Gold (took me .

Cons:
- Going through two floor portals can be quite disorienting and messes up the controls (due to continual automated attempts to flip the character upright)

It's hard not to hear about this game for all of it's memes it's created on the internet such as the imfamous "The Cake is Alive" meme. But to talk about this game it is a great game and one everyone needs to play at least once in their lives. From the get go the game makes you feel alone immediatly waking up in a small cell room greeted by the intellectual AI that is GlAd0s. Since everyone and their unborn child knows that this is a first person shooting puzzle game, i guess that's what it would be called, the puzzles at first seem really easy which they are but then get more difficult as the game goes on. I honestly found the last two or three the hardest and spent some time trying to figure them out. There's not much of a story, the second installment of the series, Portal 2, has more of a story driven game. You play as the character Chell, she doesn't talk... not once which I love because it's just you trapped doing tests and listening to an AI who wants to kill you. This especially helps with the feeling of being alone because the more the game goes on the more alone and trapped you feel. On top of that I found that this game was very creepy mainly because of GlAd0s and what she says the constant hate and sarcasm just makes me love this character more and more honestly more than Chell as a whole. It's not hard to complete the game, it should only take about 6-8 hours of completion on your first run if you have no idea what to do. But after beating the game more than once it's actually really easy to beat it even under 2 hours. If your one of those gamers who love to speed run games than you would enjoy the time chambers. This is just a mini game where you try to beat your best time on each puzzle no more no less. The other mini game is one where you have to take as little amounts of steps you can on each puzzle, it's the same as the time trial but with steps, the less steps the better. I have no real complaints about the game althought that it is very short for a game going from 6 hours to less, I also wish that there were more puzzles to go through were this has at least twenty puzzles but many of them are short lived. I give this game a rating of 7/10. It's a great game with the only problem being the length of the game.
